intro: Ceropegia incarnata subsp. hottentotorum, commonly known as the Hottentot’s ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant produces a unique type of nectar that attracts specific pollinators, such as certain moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental foliage and interesting floral structure.
